title: Manage exceptions list is empty, and Allow button does not add a site
content: On a late model Dell laptop, there are no domains listed under Exceptions-Cookies and Site Data. When I key in a domain (whether using www., http, https, or just the domain name by itself.) and click on Allow, that website is not added. It's the same as if browser security is stuck on Remove All Websites. With the same Privacy and Security settings on my desktop, I do not have this problem, so it appears not to be a matter of altering particular settings. Short of removing and reloading Firefox on the laptop, which might work but not teach anybody anything, are there suggestions?
creator: Quenchoo

title: Privacy Eraser
content:
Dear Support,

I hope somebody can help me. I write concerning a piece of software called Privacy Eraser. This basically protects privacy, by deleting your own digital footprint.

On Privacy Eraser, there is a section called Browsers, which details all the browsers a user uses. I use Firefox, but it does not show using this piece of software. (It shows other browser's like Microsoft Edge, which I do not use.)

Am I doing something wrong here, or is Firefox just disguising itself on my machine, please?

yours Marek
creator: MAREK_WES

title: Task Manager (about:performance) REMOVED!?
content:
After a recent update, I tried to use the Task Manager to view my running extensions and see WHICH extension was using a lot of memory.

I noticed that I was persistently redirected to "about:processes" instead.

Upon doing some research, I found this... https://techdows.com/2023/07/firefox-removes-about-performance-in-favor-about-processes.html https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1836191

I cannot believe this.

Why remove an incredibly useful tool, just because you feel like the other one is "better?"

about:processes is good, but gives NO option to view individual memory or CPU usage per each INDIVIDUAL extension.

Either bring the old Task Manager back, or combine both of their functionality into one page.

This is absolutely ridiculous.

I will be reverting back to the previous version.

I cannot understand why devs feel the need to completely cut and kill perfectly useful and harmless tools. This is very frustrating.
creator: Techno769

title: Firefox suggests (all) my passwords for autofill the same way it would suggest my emails lol
content:
When loging into a certain website, on mouse click onto the "password" field, firefox displays a list of all my passwords for me to select and autofill. This seems crazy to me because when i go into "logins" there is nothing saved, I never opt-in into any password reminder, let alone one which shows all your passwords without even asking.

At first I thought it might be the website's fault because the field could be tagged as email or something which would make firefox think that it should suggest old values, but in any case why the hell are all those passwords stored in firefox, and when I browse into about:logins it says "No logins found"? How do I opt out of this services and delete the stored passwords? Is it an error of the website or of Firefox?

I attach a screenshot of the suggestion, aswell as the about:login section of my Firefox. The website is https://login.segurcaixaadeslas.es/auth/realms/ssoextadeslas/protocol/openid-connect/auth?audience=global-position-app&client_id=7ce5881f-2dc0-46bd-b6ea-ef7032703148&redirect_uri=https://clientes.segurcaixaadeslas.es/&response_type=code&scope=openid&ui_locales=es The URL is a bit messy, idk if it might give problems accesing from other locations. It can be reached by clicking "Soy cliente" in https://www.segurcaixaadeslas.es/ .

This has only happened in this website, but the showed passwords have never been wrote in this website so I assume Firefox is somehow collecting them.

Thank you in advance for any help.
creator: alejandrogonzalezposeck

title: One of our macbooks isn'y syncing (bookkmarks)
content:
Unable to sync (update bookmarks made on another macbook air 11.7.7 Big Sur/current firefox), despite: clearing cache/cookies turning off macbook air (others are macbook pro) ran troubleshooting-it read 'false' for bookmarks but could not make 'true'! tried repeated sync 'now'..display took a while after trouble/refresh modes, then solid blue...still no updated bookmarks-WEIRDEST is the sync settings after pressing sync now will show the bookmarks check box immed. if I re-select it..but after going out and then back into sync setting prefs, the bookmarks check box is again unchecked (NOTE-I can't tell if that is default since I just ran a sync now, but it would be strange that it keeps removing it as a pref). The other macs are updating to each other fine..and are SAME identity (tho one macbook pro of 2 is old=2010, and is using 10.7.7. 

 These are older machines.  The only thing that I note differing in the macbook air I'm having trouble with, is it was bought/wiped from a used computer company, so sometimes readss "Soonersoft's Mac" even though I have all correct admin settings! I've no idea how to remove that other owner name (shows up when I do a system restore from disc, for example). I don't want to ramess with that b/c it presents no issues anywhere I'm aware of.....

Frustrating, esp. b/c other two macbook pros sync bookmarks fine! HOW DO I CHANGE SYSTEM DETAIL TROUBLESHOOT REPORT WHERE IT SAYS 'BOOKMARKS=FALSE?" TO TRUE??!?

title: Links don't open upon first startup of Firefox.
content: Firefox is my default web browser. When I turn on my computer to check my emails in the morning, I usually have links sent by friends/family or work. I have always been able to simply click the link and when Firefox opens it goes straight to the link. Not since the latest update. Firefox opens, but the tab remains blank as if I never clicked the link. I have to go back to my email app and re-click the link for Firefox to open it. Then it does. It will open the link as well if I open up Firefox beforehand. I tried to Refresh and default every setting but Firefox remains unable to open links upon first startup. I also deleted and re-installed Firefox but I continue to have the issue. Any ideas? Thanks!
creator: mickygivesme

title: Been getting this error message for months on just one Website
content: Current on Firefox 117.0, but that has happened on several of the previous versions. Usually see the message after sitting overnight, but not always. Always on the same website Foxnews.com- no other website. I always have 7 tabs up and running 7 X 24. All I need to do is click on the FF reload and all is fine. Also, have stopped all addons to see if they were an issue. Some of my tabs use the tab reload addon, but not this Foxnews tab. Since it don't reload with an addon, I would think Foxnews must have a script doing something and that is my question? Is Foxnews doing something via a script? Since I am not reloading it, then it should just sit there and do nothing. It got the error screen when NoScripts was running, but I have some set to Trusted on that site. Also does it with no addons running. Image below, so far I haven't sent any data, don't even know if that picture wanting data comes from FF or somewhere else, it doesn't say Firefox or Mozilla anywhere. So I haven't really trusted that window wanting data as I don't know where it comes from. That is why I click on the Firefox's reload. Malwarebytes, Microsoft and Webroot finds no virus or Malware.

title: Cant get rid of malware- googleadservices.com
content:
Hello. sadly after using Firefox for over 10 years i have to stop using it. ive been tormented with the malware googleadservices.com. Search keeps redirecting me to the above url.

i cant get the solution below to work- i cant find these options in my Firefox (v116) which is up to date askasik. i dont have 'Options' under my 'Tools' dropdown

https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/915394

Clear the cache and the cookies from sites that cause problems. "Clear the Cache": 

   Tools > Options > Advanced > Network > Offline Storage (Cache): "Clear Now"

"Remove Cookies" from sites causing problems: 

   Tools > Options > Privacy > Cookies: "Show Cookies"

title: Firefox won't let me open Apps after closing
content:
For a while now, I had the issue of apps on Windows 11 opening very delayed (approx. 10-15 seconds after the input) on irregular occasions. I was now able to figure out that Firefox seems to be the cause of the problem. Whenever I close Firefox (and thus move to another program), I'm unable to open any other app for a couple of seconds. Task Manager shows three Firefox background processes that only show upon closing it. Only when they disappear, the apps I clicked on finally open. I've tried reinstalling and cleaning Firefox, but nothing changed.

As said, I'm on Windows 11 with a i5-13600k and Firefox is installed on an SSD. I couldn't really find any information on this problem.
creator: Mangoman25

title: Micro freezing when switching context into Firefox windows
content:
Hi!

Starting today, whenever I switch context into a Firefox window it will freeze for 1 to 2 seconds, which is extremely annoying when multi-tasking. This happens either when switching from one Firefox window to another or when switching from another app into Firefox.

Happening on Firefox 117.0 64-bit, Windows 11 Insiders Build. As far as I have tested, doesn't occur when using other browsers like Edge.

Any help would be enormously appreciated.
creator: alceballosa

title: Unable to sign in to my TV provider DirecTV and watch DirecTV
content:
This is my third year running into this problem, and I am about as fed up with Firefox as I can get. I had this problem on my old PC last year, and now this year as well on my new PC.

After signing into DirecTV, and then going to watch sports games or whatever, when I click on the game to watch, it then asks me to select a provider. So I select a provider and I get caught in a stupid loop and the idiotic Firefox keeps asking me time and again to select a provider. How many freaking times do I have to select a provider?

After that, it won't even let me start over and try again, because when I try to sign in to DirecTV, I then get the following infuriating error every time: 

    You don't have permission to access "http://www.directv.com/directv-login/" on this server. 
    Reference #18.4fcda17.1693705236.1ee3ae9c

What the heck! DirecTV IS my TV provider—has been for something like 10 years. And where does Firefox get off telling me I can't sign in to my TV provider? Who made them God?

I can sign in to DirecTV on Google Chrome, and probably on Maxthon, though I don't have that browser loaded yet on my new PC. Is the solution for this infuriating and incredibly asinine problem to can Firefox and only use Chrome? Why does this keep happening year after year after freaking year?

I have used Firefox for years, but I'm about done with it now. This is the last straw if I can't get this fixed.
creator: texasandlouisiana
